intro: Anthemis cronia, commonly known as the golden everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces bright yellow flowers that are densely packed in a single head. It is known for its aromatic properties and is often used in herbal medicine. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
